long_desc.thetext:
Hello.
awstats contain non-free icons. (trademark and/or copyright)
Non-free Directory List:
"awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/browser" "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/clock" "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/cpu" "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/os"
There directory contain non-free icons. (E,g Windows logo, etc...) but there directory contain free icons. (E,g Iceweasel, etc...)
And, Missing license tag.
Directory:
awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/mime/
There icons licensed under CC-BY 2.5. It is free. See: awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/mime/readme.txt
Suggests:
1. remove non-free icon and rebuild, and add license tag.
2. Replace Fedora free (Fedora acceptable licensed) icons, and add license tag.
3. Remove fedora repos.
thanks.
Reference:
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=388571
Blocking FE-Legal, This is license problem.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 23 development cycle. Changing version to '23'.
(As we did not run this process for some time, it could affect also pre-Fedora 23 development cycle bugs. We are very sorry. It will help us with cleanup during Fedora 23 End Of Life. Thank you.)
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/BugZappers/HouseKeeping/Fedora23

How it this bug current status ? Is this bug is resolved ?
Thanks.
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.

I'm going to fix it according to the debian fix which just replaced firefox icon if I read it correctly. But the report says there are other icons which should not be included in the package. Could you provide more specific description which icons and why should not be provided by awastat package?
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.

(In reply to Petr Lautrbach from comment #5) > Could you provide more specific > description which icons and why should not be provided by awastat package?
Reason: Copyright and Trademark problem.
And, I check icons, I find non-free logo.
This is part. I find many many non-free logos. See on from this debian bug late comments.
"awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/browser/adobe.png" (Adobe logo) "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/browser/seamonkey.png" (Seamonkey logo) "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/os/win*.png" (Microsoft Windows logo) "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/os/macos*.png" (Apple MacOS logo) "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/cpu/intel.png" (Intel logo) "awstats-7.3/wwwroot/icon/cpu/ibm.png" (IBM logo)
and more.
Thanks.
Reference:
https://www.adobe.com/jp/legal/permissions/trademarks.html https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/legal/intellectualproperty/trademarks/en-us.aspx https://www.apple.com/legal/intellectual-property/guidelinesfor3rdparties.html https://developer.apple.com/softwarelicensing/agreements/maclogo.php https://www-ssl.intel.com/content/www/us/en/trademarks/intel.html https://www-ssl.intel.com/content/www/us/en/trademarks/intel-inside.html http://www.ibm.com/legal/us/en/copytrade.shtml http://www.seamonkey-project.org/legal/trademark

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase

Is this bug is resolved ?
Thanks.
Icons listed in https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1196549#c7 were replaced by unknown.png in awstats-7.4-3.fc25 and awstats-7.4-3.fc24
